channel.title: Make the "Run" open your Forums or your Voting website
channel.description:
[b]I had always wanted to add this into my client's "Run", but never knew the code. Anyways, i figured it out a few months ago, but never really used it and figured "Hey! Maybe someone wants to do this too".
Start by going into your client, and right clicking the "Run". Click "Edit" at the top and a code like this should come up:
[u]@echo off start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit[/u]
Of course, it will be the code for your client.
Alright, just under "start javaw - Xmx500m - cp .;Theme.jar Gui", add this:
[u]"start iexplore http://yahoo.com".[/u]
Of course in the "http://yahoo.com" you'll add your forums or voting website URL, but you get the idea.
Simple yet useful.
PS - Tell me if this has been posted else where, and I'll remove.[/b]

item.title: Make the "Run" open your Forums or your Voting website
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.source: Make the "Run" open your Forums or your Voting website

item.title: Make the "Run" open your Forums or your Voting website
item.dc:creator: @RunescapeBR RunescapeBR
item.description:
@RunescapeBR wrote:

[b]I had always wanted to add this into my client’s “Run”, but never knew the code. Anyways, i figured it out a few months ago, but never really used it and figured “Hey! Maybe someone wants to do this too”.

Start by going into your client, and right clicking the “Run”. Click “Edit” at the top and a code like this should come up:

@echo off
start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

Of course, it will be the code for your client.

Alright, just under “start javaw - Xmx500m - cp .;Theme.jar Gui”, add this:

“start iexplore http://yahoo.com”.

Of course in the “http://yahoo.com” you’ll add your forums or voting website URL, but you get the idea.

Simple yet useful.

PS - Tell me if this has been posted else where, and I’ll remove.[/b]
